knimeNode.name: MergeTwoVCFs
knimeNode.shortDescription: This node merges two VCF files into one combined VCF file.

fullDescription.intro: This node merges two VCF files into one combined VCF file. In this way, you can for example merge the output VCL file from Pindel with the output VCF file from GATK. This combined VCF file can the be further processed by applying nodes, which filter the called variants.

tab.name: Options
tab.option: Set threshold for repeated execution. Only used if HTE is enabled in the preference page.
Set path GenomeAnalysisTK.jar and memory usage.
Coverage analysis can be restricted to genomic regions defined in a BED file.

tab.name: CombineVariants
tab.option:
KEEP_IF_ANY_UNFILTERED: Union - leaves the record if any record is unfiltered.
KEEP_IF_ALL_UNFILTERED: Requires all records present at site to be unfiltered. VCF files that don't contain the record don't influence this.
KEEP_UNCONDITIONAL: If any record is present at this site (regardless of possibility being filtered), then all such records are kept and the filters are reset.

UNIQUIFY: Make all sample genotypes unique by file. Each sample shared across RODs gets named sample.ROD.
PRIORITIZE: Take the genotypes in priority order.
UNSORTED: Take the genotypes in any order.
REQUIRE_UNIQUE: Require that all samples/genotypes be unique between all inputs.
Prioritize input: In the case of different genotypes predicted in the two VCF files, one VCF file can be prioritized over the second.

ports.outPort: Cell 0: Path to merged VCF file.
